paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses various mutations in the TTR gene associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis (ATTRv amyloidosis), detailing patient demographics, clinical significance, and penetrance data.

patients.demographics: Mean age 44.2 years, sex not specified

individual_records.evidence_sentence: TTR gene screening was performed, with Val30Met mutation in five patients.

functional_data.summary: The Val30Met mutation is known to cause hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis.

variants.segregation_data: The Val30Met mutation segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The Val30Met mutation is one of the most common mutations associated with ATTRv amyloidosis.
key_quotes: TTR gene screening was performed, with Val30Met mutation in five patients.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: TTR gene screening was performed, with Gly83Arg mutation in three patients.

functional_data.summary: The Gly83Arg mutation is associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis.

variants.segregation_data: The Gly83Arg mutation segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The Gly83Arg mutation is less common than Val30Met but still significant.
key_quotes: TTR gene screening was performed, with Gly83Arg mutation in three patients.
